comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content: If it survived the Blitz it must still look much the same!

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: This block wasn't hit I don't think. We lived at #20 when it was Nelson Studios, so it's great to see this old photo....so close! Got any more from this era on the same street

comment.author: 24052676@N03
comment._content:
Oddly, and by a long and drawn out coincidence, my son went to some offices at 13 Nelson Rd last week!!!!! I couldn't quite believe it as I'd mentioned the area to him about something else (my middle son went to the NYT further along towards Deptford).........weird how these things happen.

You can see these buildings more clearly and take your time on the Google Street view thingumybob!

The door numbering is quite odd along there as it's sequential and goes up and down both sides changing before each corner if you get my drift.

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content:
Don't quite follow the numbering...Here we do odd on one side, even on the opposite side.
I remember the railings and balcony on these. Those two windows above would have been our living room. Very cold, and rarely used except for events like Christmas. They are very tall, narrow buildings with two rooms on each floor and a basement with spooky passageways. I found an old air raid helmet and gas mask in ours. Our basement was used for my Dad's darkroom for the Studio, and a workshop with his little printing press, where he also did business cards and flyers for people. Funny how photos bring it all back....helpful at my age...LOL!

comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Here is our house, #20 Nelson Road, as it looks today as a hair salon: www.flickr.com/photos/mando_gal/2770664713/in/set-7215760... Photo is kindly done by my friend Dave Levitt of the Greenwich group. Thanks again Dave!
